t: The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Jeremiah the prophet against the Philistines, before Pharaoh attacked Gaza.

Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Behold,*pn waters rise out of the north, And*ld shall be an overflowing flood; They*ld shall overflow the land and all that is in it, The*ld city and those who dwell within; Then*ld the men shall cry, And*ld all the inhabitants of the land shall wail.

At*ld the noise of the stamping hooves of his strong horses, At*ld the rushing of his chariots, At*ild the rumbling of his wheels, The*ld fathers will not look back for their*i children, Lacking*ld courage,

Because*ld of the day that comes to plunder all the Philistines, To*ld cut off from Tyre and Sidon every helper who remains; For*ld the Lord*s shall plunder the Philistines, The*ld remnant of the country of Caphtor.
Baldness*ld has come upon Gaza, Ashkelon*ld is cut off With*ild the remnant of their valley. How*ld long will you cut yourself?
“O*ln you sword of the Lord,*s How*ld long until you are quiet? Put*ld yourself up into your scabbard, Rest*ld and be still!
How*ld can it be quiet, Seeing*ld the Lord*s has given it a charge Against*ld Ashkelon and against the seashore? There*ld He has appointed it.”
